questions.question_text: With the PAN-OS 11.0 release, which tab becomes newly available within the Vulnerability security profile?

DRAG DROP
-

Drag the steps into the correct order to create a static route.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct Sequence is ;
1.Add an IPv4 or IPv6 route by name.
2.Enter the route and netmask
3.Specify the outgoing interface for packets to use to go to the next hop
4.Enter the IP address for the specific next hop

Correct Sequence is ;
1.Add an IPv4 or IPv6 route by name.
2.Enter the route and netmask
3.Specify the outgoing interface for packets to use to go to the next hop
4.Enter the IP address for the specific next hop

comments.content: I have my firewall open on Virtual Router in front of me and the answer is wrong.: Name;Destination; Interface; Next Hop

discussion.content:
Name 
Route and netmask
Outgoing interface (Optional)
IP address for the specific next hop
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/networking/static-routes/configure-a-static-route

B, C - Based on the information available, the two ways to implement an exception to an external dynamic list in Palo Alto Networks are:

Select the entries to exclude from the List Entries list. You can view the entries of an external dynamic list and select up to 100 entries to exclude from the list1.
Manually add an entry to the Manual Exceptions list. You can manually add a list exception1.

questions.question_text: What are the two ways to implement an exception to an external dynamic list? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Edit the external dynamic list by removing the entries to exclude.
choices.C: Manually add an entry to the Manual Exceptions list.
choices.D: Edit the external dynamic list by adding the “-“ symbol before the entries to exclude.
choices.B: Select the entries to exclude from the List Entries list.

discussion.content: in other words the admin doesn't want to match intrazone traffic it is clearly an interzone traffic as the universal means the whole thing. A is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
Interzone
The administrator does not want to match traffic where the source and destination zones are LAN/VPN

Selected Answer: A
not want to match traffic where the source and destination zones are LAN

questions.question_text:
An administrator needs to create a Security policy rule that matches DNS traffic sourced from either the LAN or VPN zones, destined for the DMZ or Untrust zones.

The administrator does not want to match traffic where the source and destination zones are LAN, and also does not want to match traffic where the source and destination zones are VPN.

Which Security policy rule type should they use?

choices.B: Because the destination zone, address, and device are all "any"
choices.A: Because antivirus inspection is enabled for this policy
choices.D: Because the Security-EDL tag has been assigned the red color
